definition: the right flank/(politically) right-wing
right (-hand)/the Right (politics)/west (old)
wing/area surrounding the bullseye of a target/to assist/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/old variant of 翌
surname Yi/alternative name for 絳|绛[Jiang4] capital of the Jin State during the Spring and Autumn Period (770-475 BC)

definition: extreme right (politics)

sentences.english: A searchlight is added in the right wing.
sentences.chinese: 右翼下加装了搜索探照灯。

sentences.english: Also for her right-wing, pro-corporate alliance with US President Regan.
sentences.chinese: 还为她右翼，有利于企业联盟与美国总统里根。

sentences.english: This must be some type of right wing tea party conspiracy theory.
sentences.chinese: 这一定是某种类型的右翼茶党的阴谋论。

sentences.english: A hard-core group of right- wing senators had hoped to sway their colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 一群骨干右翼参议员曾企图左右自己的同僚。

sentences.english: As early as the fourth minute, he had bamboozled Scotland with a fluent run from right wing to penalty box.
sentences.chinese: 第四分钟，他从右翼到禁区的跑动骗过了苏格兰人。

sentences.english: Some Right-wing commentators have seized approvingly on the image.
sentences.chinese: 一些右翼评论家称赞这张海报。

sentences.english: This produces a far right that likes nationalisation and dislikes the market.
sentences.chinese: 这催生了喜好国有化，厌恶市场的极右翼主义。

sentences.english: The dominant tendency in the party remained right-wing.
sentences.chinese: 党内占主导地位的依旧是右翼势力。

sentences.english: In chapter four, the foreground of the European ultra-rightist parties is addressed.
sentences.chinese: 第四章欧洲极右翼政党的发展前景。

sentences.english: I sell to leftist and rightist.
You must be a Japanese right wing spy under disguise.
sentences.chinese: 你一定是个伪装好的日本右翼间谍。

sentences.english: The formation of the NCD makes the threat even more remote.
sentences.chinese: 新中右翼党的形成让这种威胁变得更加遥远。

sentences.english: On the right, that gangsters and anti-social elements are taking advantage of tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 右翼则认为，抢匪和反社会分子乘此机会落井下石。

sentences.english: The statement sent chills through anyone fearing right-wing thought control.
sentences.chinese: 这些话令那些害怕右翼思想控制的人感到沮丧。

sentences.english: Silva is a member of the rightist People's Party.
sentences.chinese: 席尔瓦是葡萄牙右翼党派民众党成员。

sentences.english: They turned the right flank of the enemy troop.
sentences.chinese: 他们迂回到敌军的右翼。

definition: left-wing (political)
to outflank/to envelop
to conspire/to plot (a rebellion, crime etc)/to machinate/to spur on/to urge action
to attack violently/to storm
to pull back (an army)/to retreat
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack

to sally/to attack
surprise attack
defensive line or perimeter/CL:道[dao4]
to provide support/to come to the rescue
pincer attack/attack from two or more sides/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
to defeat/to smash/to rout
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
